lines.text: Did you really call the police?
You bet your sorry ass I did.

[starting to cry]
My mom and dad are gonna be so mad at me!
You sick fucks. You've seen one too many movies!
Now Sid, don't you blame the movies. Movies don't create psychos. Movies make psychos more creative!
What's your favorite scary movie?
No, please don't kill me, Mr. Ghostface, I wanna be in the sequel!
Shit...
What?
Oh, shit.

[They go into the kitchen to find Sidney and Mr. Prescott gone]
Where are they? Where are they?
I don't know, Billy, but I'm hurtin', man!
[the phone rings]
Should I let the machine get it?

[answers it]
Hello?
Are you alone in the house?
Bitch! You bitch, where the fuck are you?
Guess who just called the police and reported your sorry motherfucking ass!
[Stu is slowly collapsing to the floor]
Find her, you dipshit! Get up!
I can't, Billy. You already cut me too deep. I think I'm dying here, man!
[Billy gives Stu the phone]

[whispers]
Talk to her. Talk to her.
Hello?
Ah, Stu, Stu, Stu... What's your motive? Billy's got one. The police are on their way. What are you going to tell them?
Peer pressure. I'm far too sensitive.
[Billy takes the phone back]
I'm going to rip you up, bitch, just like your fucking mother!
You've gotta find me first, you pansy-ass momma's boy!
Fuck!
[He accidentally hits Stu with the phone]
Ow! You fuckin' hit me with the phone, dick!
you can never have sex.
[crowd boos]
you can never drink or do drugs.
[crowd cheers and raises their bottles]
never, ever, ever under any circumstances say, "I'll be right back." Because you won't be back.
I'm gettin' another beer, you want one?
Yeah, sure.
I'll be right back.
[crowd cheers]
See, you push the laws and you end up dead. Okay, I'll see you in the kitchen with a knife.
Do you like scary movies?

What's the point? They're all the same. Some stupid killer stalking some big-breasted girl who can't act who is always running up the stairs when she should be running out the front door. It's insulting.
Listen, asshole...

[interrupting]
No, *you* listen to me you little bitch! You hang up on me again and I'll gut you like a fish!
Jesus, the camera, hurry!
My name isn't Jesus.

[licks "blood" from his fingers]
Mmmm... corn syrup. Same stuff they used for pig's blood in "Carrie."

[Gale, Sid and Randy are looking at Billy's body]
Careful. This is the moment when the supposedly dead killer comes back to life, for one last scare.
[Billy starts to rise]

[shoots Billy]
Not in my movie.

[when Randy reveals that he's still alive]
Oh, my God. Randy I thought you were dead.
I probably should be. I never thought I'd be so happy to be a virgin.
Who's there?
Never say "who's there?" Don't you watch scary movies? It's a death wish. You might as well come out to investigate a strange noise or something.

[quoting Norman Bates]
We all go a little mad sometimes.
Name the killer in Friday the 13th.
Jason! Jason! Jason!
I'm sorry. That's the wrong answer!
No, it's not. No it's not. It was Jason.
Afraid not. No way.
Listen, it was Jason! I saw that movie 20 goddamn times!
Then you should know that Jason's mother, Mrs. Voorhees was the original killer. Jason didn't show up until the sequel. I'm afraid that was a wrong answer.

[Weeping]
You tricked me.
Lucky for you there's a bonus round, but poor Steve... I'm afraid he's OUT!
Look, Kenny, I know you're about fifty pounds overweight, but when I say hurry, please interpret that as, MOVE YOUR FAT TUB OF LARD ASS, NOW!
The police are always off track with this shit! If they'd watch Prom Night, they'd save time! There's a formula to it. A very simple formula!
[yelling in video store]
EVERYBODY'S A SUSPECT!
I wanna see breasts. I wanna see Jamie Lee's breasts. When do we see Jamie Lee's breasts?
Breasts? Not until "Trading Places" in 1983. Jamie Lee was always a virgin in horror movies. She didn't show her tits 'til she went legits.

[speaking into voicebox]
Surprise, Sidney.
She was never attacked. I think she made it all up.
Why would she lie about it?
For attention. The girl has some serious issues. What if she did it? What if Sidney killed Casey and Steve?
Why would she do that?
Maybe she had the hots for Steve and killed them both in a jealous rage.
What would Sidney want with Steve? She's got her own bubble-butt boyfriend, Billy.
Maybe she's a slut, just like her mother.
Cut some slack. She watched her mom get butchered.

And it fucked her up royally. Think about it, her mother's death leaves her disturbed and hostile in a cruel and inhumane world. She's delusional. "Where's God," etc. Completely suicidal. One day she snaps. She wants to kill herself but she realizes out that teen suicide is out this year and homicide is a much healthier, therapeutic expression.
Where do you get this shit?
Ricky Lake.
You are pathetic.
[They leave the bathroom]
If you were the only suspect in a senseless bloodbath - would you be standing in the horror section?
Why? Why did you kill my mother?
Why? WHY! You hear that, Stu? I think she wants a motive.
[Stu Chortles]
Well, I don't really believe in motives, Sid. I mean did Norman Bates have a motive?
No.

Did we ever find out why Hannibal Lecter like to eat people? DON'T THINK SO! See, it's a lot more scarier when there's no motive, Sid. We did your Mom a favour, Sid. That woman was a slut-bag whore who flashed her shit all over town like she was Sharon Stone or somethin'.
Yeah, we put her out of her misery, 'cause let's face Sidney, your mother was no Sharon Stone, hmm?
Is that motive enough for you? How about this? Your slut mother was fucking my father, and she's the reason my mom moved out and abandoned me.
[Sid looks astonished]
How's that for a motive? Maternal abandonment causes serious deviant behavior. It certainly fucked you up. It made you have sex with a psychopath.
That's right. You gave it up. Now, you're no longer a virgin. You're not a virgin. Now you got to die. Those are the rules.
So, this game is like a scary movie, Sid. How do you think it's going to end?
Oh, this is the greatest fun. You're going to love this. We got a surprise for you, Sidney. Yeah, you're going to love this one. It's a scream, baby. Hold a second, be right back.
If I'm right about this, I could save a man's life. Do you know what that would do for my book sales?
But this is life. This isn't a movie.
Sure it is, Sid. It's all a movie. It's all one great big movie.
[pauses]
. Only you can pick your genre.
So, two of your fellow students, just savagely murdered, and this is the way that you show your compassion and sensitivity, huh? Let me tell you something...
[pause]
You're both expelled. Get out!
Aw, come on, Mr. Himbry. It was just a joke!
That is not fair!
You're absolutely right. It is not fair. Fairness would be to rip your insides out and hang you from a tree so we can expose you for the heartless, desensitized little shits that you are!
It's the millennium. Motives are incidental.
Guess I remembered the safety that time, bastard.

[as Kenny's dead body lies over the windshield]
Oh, God, Kenny. I'm sorry, but get off my fucking windshield!
"I'll send you a copy." BAM! Bitch went down. "I'll send you a copy." BAM! Sid! Superbitch!
Stupidity Leak!
How do you - gut someone?
You take a knife and you slit 'em from groin to sternum.
Hey. It's called tact, you fuck-rag.
[last lines]

Okay I think it's going to go something like this, just stay with me. Hi, this is Gale Weathers with an exclusive eyewitness account of this amazing breaking story. Several more local teens are dead, bringing to an end the harrowing mystery of the masked killings that has terrified this peaceful community like the plot of some scary movie. It all began with the scream of a 911, and ended in a bloodbath that has rocked the town of Woodsboro. All played out here in this peaceful farmhouse, far from the crimes and the sirens of the larger cities that its residents have fled. Okay, let's take it back to one. Come on, move it! This is my big shot. Let's go.
Liver alone!

[killer's Voice]
What's the matter Sidney? You look like you've seen a ghost.
Now that Billy tried to mutilate her, do you think Sid would go out with me?
I will totally protect you. Yo, I am so buff, I got you covered, girl.
There's always some stupid bullshit reason to kill your girlfriend. That's the beauty of it all! Simplicity! Besides, if it gets too complicated, you lose your target audience.
Because there's no way a girl could have killed them.
That is so sexist. The killer could easily be female. Basic Instinct.
That was an ice pick. Not exactly the same thing.
Yeah, Casey and Steve were completely hollowed out. Takes a man to do something like that.
Or a man's mentality.
Why are you doing this?
It's all part of the game, Sidneeeee!
[raises machine to mouth and shouts]
It's called GUESS HOW I'M GONNA DIE!
Fuck you!
We've already played that game. Remember? You lost.
You still haven't told me your name.

[smiling]
Why do you want to know my name?
Because I want to know who I'm looking at.

[looks around, frightened]
... What did you say?

[short pause]
I said I want to know who I'm talking to.
That's not what you said.

[serious tone]
What do you think I said?

[Talking on the phone to Ghostface]
What do you want?
To see what your insides look like.
[Billy and Stu are looking for the gun]
Where the fuck is it?

[off camera]
Right here, asshole.
I thought she was dead.
She looked dead, man. Still does.
Sidney, how does it feel to be almost brutally butchered? People want to know. They have a right to know! How does it feel?
Who am I? The beer wench?
As if.
Oh, really, Alicia?
Look, I am two seconds away from calling the police!
They'll never make it in time.
Looks like we've got a serial killer on our hands!
Well, a "serial killer" is not really accurate. Gotta knock off a couple more to get that title.
Well, we can hope, can't we? I mean, we certainly don't have any leads. Have you located Sidney's father yet?
No, not yet.
Well, he's not a suspect, is he?
We haven't ruled him out as a possibility.
[He becomes aware that he is gazing too long at her eyes]
If you'll excuse me.
[Dewey turns away, but Gale pursues and grabs his arm]
I'm sorry, am I keeping you?

[Turning back to her, he removes his hat]
If I may say so, Miss Weathers, you are much prettier in person.
[He gives her a flirty smile and turns away again to run up the school steps]

[delighted]
So you do watch the show!
[Dewey stops and turns back]
I'm 25. I was 24 for a whole year.
[first lines]
Hello?
Hello.
Yes?
Who is this?
Who are you trying to reach?
What number is this?
Well, what number are you trying to reach?
I don't know.
I think you have the wrong number.
Do I?
It happens. Take it easy.
I didn't kill anybody.
Nobody said you did.
Thanks, buddy!
Besides... "Takes a MAN to do something like that!"
I ought to gut your ass in a second, kid.

[using Jerry Lewis' voice]
Tell me something. Did you really put her liver in the mailbox? Because I heard they found her liver in the mailbox next to her spleen and her pancreas.
Billy and his penis don't deserve you.
Wait, I thought we were going to go out.

[uneasily, starting to feel nervous]
Um, I don't think so.

[in a warning tone]
Don't hang up on me.

[she hangs up. The phone rings again]
Yes?

[in an ominous, taunting threatening tone]
I told you not to hang up on me.
What do you want?
Why can't I be a Meg Ryan movie? Or even a good porno.

[about Casey Becker's death]
It's so sad. Her mom and dad found her hanging from a tree limb, her insides on the outside.
I always had a thing for ya, Sid!
[She bites his hand and he screams]
Ohhhhh, God! Bitch!
In your dreams!
[She shoves the television at him]
[Gale runs across the school campus to Dewey]
Is there a problem on campus?
No. Everything's under control.

[seductively]
Well, of course. You're here.
You're not supposed to be here.
I know. I should be in New York covering the Sharon Stone stalker, but who knew?
[giggles]
You look awfully young to be a police officer.
I'm 25 years old.
You know, in a demographic study, I proved to be most popular amongst males 11 to 24. I guess I just missed you.
[giggles flirtatiously]
Of course, you don't look a day over 12. Except in that...
[She looks him up and down, admiringly]
... upper torso area. Does the force require you to work out?

]
No, ma'am. 'Cause of my boyish good looks, muscle mass has increased my acceptance as a serious police officer.
[They smile at each other]
He's my superior!
Janitor is your superior.
Hello?
Why don't you wanna talk to me?
Who is this?
You tell me your name, I'll tell you mine.
I don't think so.
[checks popcorn]
What's that noise?
Popcorn!
You're making popcorn?
Uh huh.
I only eat popcorn at the movies.
Well, I'm getting ready to watch a video.
Really, what?
Oh, just some scary movie.
Do you like scary movies?
Uh huh.
What's your favourite scary movie?
I dunno.
You have to have a favourite, what comes to mind?
There she is! Sidney, hi, what happened? Are you alright?
She's not answering any questions alright. Just leave us alone.
No, no Tatum it's OK. She's just doing her job, right Gale?
That's right.
So how's the book?
Oh it'll be out later this year.
Oh, I'll look for it.
I'll send you a copy.
[Sidney turns around a punches Gale in the face]
People treat me like I'm the anti-Christ of television journalism.
Well, you're not going to be alone any more, right? If you pee, I pee. Is that clear?
Listen up. They found Principal Himbry dead. He was gutted and hung from the goal post on the football field.
Well, what are we waiting for? Let's go over there before they pry him down!
It's called subtlety, Stu. You should look it up.
Hey Sid, just think - if they make a movie about you, who's gonna play you?
I shudder to think.
I see you as a young Meg Ryan, myself.
Thanks, Dewey, but with my luck I'd get Tori Spelling.
Cut Casper, that's a wrap!
What do I have to do to prove to you that I'm not a killer?

[looks out door]
Damn little shits.
What'd you call me? Huh?
Not you Fred.
You prick!
Can you see me right now?
Ah, okay.
[puts a finger in her nose]
What am I doing? Huh? Huh? What am I doing? Hello?
[takes finger out]
Nice try, Randy. Tell Tatum to hurry up, okay? Bye now.
IF YOU HANG UP ON ME, YOU'LL DIE JUST LIKE YOUR MOTHER! Do you want to die, Sidney? Your mother sure didn't.
Fuck you, you cretin!
[a student dressed as the Ghostface killer is running down the halls screaming]
Why are they doing this?
Look at this place, it's like Christmas!

[to Stu]
Stupidity leak!
You make me so sick. Your entire havoc-inducing, thieving, whoring generation disgusts me.
You know, if, if I was wrong about Cotton Weary, then the killer's still out there.
Don't go there, Sid. You're starting to sound like some Wes Carpenter flick or something. Don't freak yourself out, okay? We've got a long night ahead of us.

[to Gale]
Nice welt, sweetie.
Can you tell me anything?
Yeah, you're a real pain in the ass!
